meanings.definition: An act or instance of assuming control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: The takeover of the playground by the older kids caused chaos.
meanings.sent2: The business takeover was completed smoothly and efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The takeover of the remote control by the cat led to a night of watching animal documentaries.
meanings.sent4: The sudden storm's takeover of the sunny sky was unexpected.
meanings.sent5: The army's takeover of the enemy's territory was swift and strategic.

meanings.definition: The acquisition of control or possession of a company or other organization.
meanings.sent1: The hostile takeover of the company resulted in major changes.
meanings.sent2: The successful takeover of the restaurant chain expanded their business.
meanings.sent3: The takeover of the ice cream shop by penguins was a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: The takeover of the market by the new brand was a game-changer.
meanings.sent5: The merger led to a friendly takeover of the smaller company.
